text: Kenneth Bogner is an American politician from the state of Montana. He is a member of the Montana Senate, representing the 19th district. Bogner served in the United States Marine Corps as a combat engineer. He completed two tours of duty in the Middle East during the Iraq War. After he completed his military service, Bogner utilized the G.I. Bill to earn his bachelor's degree in political science from Columbia University. He also earned a Master of Public Policy from Middlesex University. He returned to Montana and served as chief of staff for the majority leader of the Montana Senate and then as a field representative for Steve Daines. Bogner was elected to the Montana Senate in 2018. Albert Olszewski selected Bogner as his running mate in the 2020 Montana gubernatorial election. Bogner's brother, Chris, also served in the Marines. ==References== ==External links== Category:Living people Category:Montana state senators Category:Montana Republicans Category:Political chiefs of staff Category:Columbia University alumni Category:United States Marine Corps personnel Category:Alumni of Middlesex University Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Kenneth Bogner
